conclusion: Need to analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph to determine collision time.
Graph shows velocities of Car A and Car B over time; Car A starts at 25 m/s, Car B at 15 m/s, both decrease linearly.
Calculate deceleration of Car A as -5/6 m/s².
Calculate deceleration of Car B as -1/2 m/s².
Determine position function for Car A: s_A(t) = 25t - 5/12t².
Determine position function for Car B: s_B(t) = 15t - 1/4t².
Find collision time by setting s_A(t) = s_B(t) and solving for t.
Solve equation to find t = 60 seconds.
Conclude collision occurs at t = 60 seconds, which is after 20 seconds.
Final answer: The two cars collide after 20 seconds of braking.
